key_13.set1: Greatest Story Ever Told, Sugaree, Chinatown Shuffle, Black Throated Wind, Tennessee Jed, Mr. Charlie, Beat It On Down The Line, China Cat Sunflower-> I Know You Rider, Mexicali Blues, Loser, Next Time You See Me, Playin' In The Band, Dire Wolf

key_14.name: Grateful Dead
key_14.set1: Cold Rain And Snow, Me And Bobby McGee*, Chinatown Shuffle*, China Cat Sunflower* > I Know You Rider*, Jack Straw*, He's Gone*, Next Time You See Me*, Black-Throated Wind
key_14.set2: Casey Jones, Mr. Charlie, Playing In The Band, Sugaree, One More Saturday Night*, Hurts Me Too*, Ramble On Rose*, El Paso*, Big Railroad Blues*, Truckin'*
key_14.set3: Dark Star, Sugar Magnolia, Caution (Do Not Stop On Tracks), Johnny B. Goode
key_14.comment:
* - Recorded by Danish Television for subsequent broadcast as "TV from the Tivoli" in three parts on April 17, 1972, August 12, 1972 and August 25, 1972.
There was no encore for this show. "One More Saturday Night" was played in the second set and was the intended final song for the TV broadcast, which explains why Bob Weir said "Bye, bye" at the end of the song. The television cameras were not on for the third set.

key_15.name: Grateful Dead
key_15.set1: Bertha Playing In The Band * Mr. Charlie Sugaree One More Saturday Night Playing In The Band * Beat It On Down The Line Truckin' Drums The Other One
key_15.comment: Jerry Garcia - Guitar Bob Weir - Guitar Ron "Pigpen" McKernan - Keyboards Keith Godchaux - Piano Phil Lesh - Bass Bill Kreutzmann - Drums Donna Jean Godchaux - Vocals *

key_31.name: Grateful Dead
key_31.set1:
Part 1
The Wembley Pool concerts and what Bobby thought of the audience response The way in which the band put a set together How The Dead improvise and move from one song to another How the music is developing Pigpen's planned solo album More about the improvisation Workingman's Dead A live album to come (Europe '72) The future of the band A sociological phenomena! The Dead Family structure Europe '72 tour European audiences
Part 2
About Bobby's, then newly released, album "Ace"

key_86.name: Grateful Dead
key_86.set1: Around & Around, Deal, Mexicali Blues, Brown Eyed Women, Box Of Rain, Jack Straw, Don't Ease Me In, Beat It On Down The Line, Candyman, El Paso, Tennessee Jed, Playin' In The Band, Casey Jones**
key_86.set2: Promised Land, Mississippi Half Step, Big River, Sugaree, Truckin'-> The Other One-> Drums-> The Other One*-> Morning Dew*, Sugar Magnolia, Sing Me Back Home, Johnny B. Goode, E: Uncle John's Band, E: One More Saturday Night
key_86.comment: *with David Crosby on either or both; **came back to play Casey Jones; FM broadcast KSAN; Other artists on bill: NRPS; Sons Of Champlin; user reports "Bear said this was the last night the Kool-Aid acid medium was used."

key_87.name: Grateful Dead
key_87.comment: compilation of Pigpen tunes from Pigpen's Last Tour
